title: 2013 Fischer Motive 76 Powerrail Skis Review By Skis.com
description: http://www.skis.com/Fischer-Motive-76-Skis-with-RS-11-Powerrail-Bindings-2013/278179P,default,pd.html  The Fischer Motive 76 is a great ski for the intermediate skier who likes to spend almost all of their time on the groomers making medium radius turns.

asset.author: skisdotcom
asset.hookText: http://www.skis.com/Fischer-Motive-76-Skis-with-RS-11-Powerrail-Bindings-2013/278179P,default,pd.html  The Fischer Motive 76 is a great ski for the intermediate skier who likes to spend almost all of their time on the groomers making medium radius turns. The Sandwich Sidewall Construction gives the Motive 76 strong torsional strength, and great edge grip on the ice or firm snow. A wood core has a very lively feel that makes it very easy for you to snap quick turns. The Carbon Tech Construction has a network of carbon fibers that have a strong torsional strength, and a balanced stiffness pattern, to give you a ski that will flex longitudinally, while still being stiff torsionally. The 17m (@175cm) turning radius makes perfect medium arcs down a wide open groomer. If you still like your skis to be skinny at the waist, and want some power behind them, the Fischer Motive 76 will be a great choice for you.
